title: Affordable Care Act (ACA)
who: Enacted by the United States Congress and signed into law by President Barack Obama
context: Aimed to expand access to affordable health insurance, improve healthcare quality, and reduce costs

mainPoints.title: Individual Mandate
mainPoints.description: Required most individuals to have health insurance coverage or face a penalty

mainPoints.title: Insurance Marketplaces
mainPoints.description: Established state-based or federally facilitated exchanges for individuals and small businesses to compare and purchase health insurance plans

mainPoints.title: Medicaid Expansion
mainPoints.description: Expanded Medicaid eligibility to cover more low-income individuals and families

mainPoints.title: Insurance Reforms
description: Prohibited insurance companies from denying coverage or charging higher premiums based on pre-existing conditions
Set limits on age-based premium variations

mainPoints.title: Essential Health Benefits
mainPoints.description: Defined a set of essential health benefits that insurance plans must cover

mainPoints.title: Subsidies and Tax Credits
mainPoints.description: Provided financial assistance to lower-income individuals and families to help them afford insurance premiums

outcomes: Protection for individuals with pre-existing conditions
